original_title: Sri Lanka’ shares down in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on Monday, as the market was consolidating on the International Monetary Fund agreement discussion due on March 20, an analyst said.
All Share Price Index was down 0.93 percent or 89.41 points to 9,5173.55 points, while the most liquid share S&P SL20 was down 0.77 percent or 21.63 points to 2,801.51.

“The market has been on a constant green for the last few sessions and is bound to come down, which is what we are seeing now. The market went down on profit taking and consolidations on the IMF,” the analyst said.
The market generated a turnover of 792 million rupees during 113o hours.
“The market went up from 8,900 to 9,700 solely on news of the IMF being finalized, with this the market is bound to come down,” the analyst said.
Top losers during mid day trade were Lanka IOC, DFCC and Central Finance Company. (Colombo/Dec13/2023)
